snippet: King Abdullah for the first time granted women seats on the Shura council, but they will have to wear conservative Islamic head covering and use doors, offices and seating areas separate from the men.
abstract: Saudi Arabia's King Abdullah issues decree that for first time gives women seats on royal advisory council, but they will have to wear conservative Islamic head covering and use doors, offices and seating areas separate from men.
lead_paragraph: King Abdullah for the first time granted women seats on the Shura council, but they will have to wear conservative Islamic head covering and use doors, offices and seating areas separate from the men.

headline.seo: Saudi Arabia’s King Lets Women Sit on Advisory Council
headline.main: Saudi Arabia’s King Allows Women to Join National Advisory Council
headline.print_headline:
Saudi Arabia: King Allows Women
To Join a Royal Advisory Body

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
